thread.title: Britain’s Got Talent: Disastrous act gone wrong causes chaos on set
thread.title_full: Britain’s Got Talent: Disastrous act gone wrong causes chaos on set

title: Britain’s Got Talent: Disastrous act gone wrong causes chaos on set
text:
Britain’s Got Talent: Disastrous act gone wrong causes chaos on set Britain’s Got Talent: Disastrous act gone wrong causes chaos on set A BRITAIN’S Got Talent contestant almost blew all the electrics when his water-tank escape act went disastrously wrong. / Published 13th February 2017 
Illusionist Matt Johnson had hoped to wow everyone with a breathtaking stunt for the ITV show. 
He planned to chain himself up, lower himself into a tank full of water then miraculously break free before running out of air. But his spectacular act was hit by a jinx. 
The weight of water cracked the tank and sent thousands of litres of water flooding all over the stage. Panic-stricken TV chiefs evacuated the venue fearing the water would come in contact with the electric equipment surrounding the stage and start a blaze. 
GETTY/PJ OPPS: Matt the illusionist flooded the BGT set when his escapist act went horribly wrong Amanda Holden in pictures Monday, 22nd August 2016 Amanda Holden and some of the best and sexiest pictures of the famous British presenter and BGT judge. 1 / 12 
A source said: “It caused a massive delay in filming. Thankfully it was a rehearsal and Simon Cowell and the judges had not yet arrived.” 
Last night a BGT spokesman said: “During an on-stage rehearsal a tank of water being used by an act accidentally cracked and flooded the stage. 
“The water was swiftly cleared up and the auditions started as planned.” 
Escapologists appear doomed on the show. In 2008, Nicky Flash got trapped in a duvet and had to be rescued. 
SPOOKY:Tamzin and Miranda are starring in a new horror-comedy series INSIDE NUMBER 9 
Here are ex-EastEnders actress Tamzin Outhwaite and Miranda star Sarah Hadland as you’ve never seen them before – dressed up as Amy Winehouse and Britney Spears. “The script is great and when I found out that Sarah was in it too, playing my character’s love rival, it was just brilliant because she is an old friend of mine” Tamzin Outhwaite 
Both are appearing in the new series of cult horror comedy Inside Number 9. Their episode called The Empty Orchestra is set in a karaoke club and the pair – seen here in fancy dress as their favourite pop icons – play love rivals for the same man. 
Tamzin said: “The script is great and when I found out that Sarah was in it too, playing my character’s love rival, it was just brilliant because she is an old friend of mine. 
“My character Connie has got some great lines and the fact that she turns up in fancy dress as Amy Winehouse was another reason – to be able to dress up like that was just brilliant.” 
Inside Number 9 is on BBC Two on Tuesday, February 21, at 10pm. 
RANDY: The Made in Chelsea hunk is trying his luck with Austrian gals THE JUMP 
Randy Spencer Matthews has started chasing the local lasses in Austria – as he has run out of fellow contestants. 
The Made In Chelsea hunk was rumoured to have got close to Vogue Williams and Jade Jones on the Channel 4 show. 
But last night’s evictee Mark Dolan claims Spencer has turned his charms on “Tyrolean totty”. The Jump 2017 line up: Confirmed celebrities revealed for series four Monday, 6th February 2017 The Jump 2017 contestants cast - see who's on The Jump this year 1 / 15 
The comic said: “He has run out of female cast members and focused his attention on Austria’s fi nest young women. I think the ladies of Innsbruck have enjoyed his charm.” 
Mark says Sir Bradley Wiggins is competitive and plays mind games. 
He added: “When you are competing against him there is no worse enemy to have. We were having banter before the race but once we got out there he became this winning machine.” 
SILLY: Comedia Romesh took a jab at Will.I.am's style sensibilities ROOM 101 
There is clearly no love lost between the BBC and its old talent show The Voice now it has moved to ITV. 
On this week’s Room 101, it gets a battering. Guest Romesh Ranganathan, claims Will.i.am should be banished as his judging skills are so bad. 
He says of his outfits: “The way he dresses is unacceptable. He’s encouraging normal people to dress like that and they’re going to get beaten up.” 
Host Frank Skinner adds: “We on the BBC think The Voice is a spent force. The sooner it is put out of its misery the better.” 
The show airs on Friday on BBC One at 8.30pm. Related articles
